TF030781-SPANISH CTF - FY06 (CHINA,

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Project is to
            assist the Borrower in improving passenger and freight
            traffic flows in an efficient and safe manner along the
            corridor from Ankang to Maoba in Shaanxi Province by: (i)
            enhancing road infrastructure capacity and network
            integration along the corridor Ankang-Maoba; (ii) increasing
            accessibility to markets and social services for the
            lower-income families in rural areas of Ankang; and (iii)
            strengthening Shaanxi Provincial Communications
            Department's capacity in managing the increasing number
            of kilometers of roads under its responsibility in the
            Shaanxi province and, in particular, within the Ankang
            region. There are 3 components to the Project. Component A
            is the Ankang-Maoba Expressway (AME). This component
            includes the construction of an 87 km expressway connecting
            Ankang and Maoba and includes the construction of the
            relevant ancillary buildings and the acquisition of the
            relevant electrical and mechanical (E&M) facilities. It
            will also require the acquisition of land and the
            resettlement of people. The design of the AME has paid
            adequate consideration to road safety features and has
            minimized the social and environmental impacts, based on the
            analysis undertaken at the feasibility stage and further
            adjustments required upon completion of the preliminary
            engineering designs. A joint local-foreign consulting firm
            will supervise the construction of the AME, in a manner
            similar to the one implemented under the AME component o f
            the Second Shaanxi Provincial Highway Project. Component B
            is the Local Roads Improvement Program (LRIP). The LRIP aims
            at improving of interconnection between provincial, county
            and village roads in the rural areas surrounding the
            corridor Ankang - Maoba Expressway. The interventions will
            consist of rehabilitation of existing roadways, with
            adjustments to its width when necessary or upgrading
            existing non-motorized tracks to motorized substandard
            roadways when warranted by the number of beneficiaries and
            due consideration to environmental impacts. Component C is
            the Institutional Strengthening Program (ISP). The
            institutional strengthening program includes: (a) evaluation
            and monitoring studies to measure impacts of LRIP on the
            socio-economic and transport conditions in Ankang City; (b)
            acquire road-condition data collection equipment to
            strengthen the information base of Shaanxi Provincial
            Communications Department (SPCD); (c) technical assistance
            in using the road-condition data collection equipment and
            incorporating the information into the pavement management
            system currently installed at SPCD; and (d) training for
            staff from the SPCD and the Ankang Communications Bureau.
